meanings.sent1: The globe is divided into a northern and southern hemisphere.
meanings.sent2: She held the toy ball, showing only one hemisphere at a time.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the sphere disappear, leaving only half a hemisphere behind.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a hemisphere, only revealing half of his thoughts at a time.
meanings.sent5: The cake was shaped like a hemisphere, with one side covered in frosting.

meanings.definition: A half of the Earth, usually divided into northern and southern or eastern and western parts
meanings.sent1: The equator divides the Earth into two hemispheres.
meanings.sent2: People in the northern hemisphere experience winter at a different time than those in the southern hemisphere.
meanings.sent3: The pirate searched for treasure in the eastern hemisphere, but found only sand.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like the western hemisphere, torn between two conflicting desires.
meanings.sent5: The map displayed the globe with clear lines marking the eastern and western hemispheres.
